required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Physiological Response to Prolonged Fasting in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate energy metabolism, anthropometry, blood pressure, gut microbiome, serum metabolome, glucose variability and neural mechanisms of food choice and mood before and after 5 days of fasting as well as their persistence in healthy men and women.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
6-th day of fasting and 28 days after fasting compared to baseline
6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Mean of five consecutive blood pressure measurements (mmHg)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Mean of five consecutive blood pressure measurements (mmHg)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood effector T cell frequencies (Percent)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 3 days before until 6 days after fasting
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by continuous glucose monitoring over 14 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging

secondary_outcome.measure: Neural correlates of food-specific delay discounting
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Range 0-100, with 0 indicating no perceived stress

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Range 10-40, with 40 indicating highest self efficiency

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Range 10-50, with 50 indicating highest positive affect

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Range 10-50, with 50 indicating highest negative affect

secondary_outcome.measure: International Physical Activity Questionaire (IPAQ, long version)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6-th day of fasting and 12 weeks after fasting compared to baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Time for moderate and vigorous activity (hours, minutes)

arm_group.description: Starts immediately with 5 days of Buchinger fasting
Starts with 5 days of Buchinger fasting after a waiting period of 12 weeks

intervention.description: Caloric intake of < 250 kcal/d for 5 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women
- 20-50 years
- Body mass index 20-30 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically relevant heart, lung, liver, and kidney diseases
- Any prescribed medication (except for oral contraceptives)
- Current or chronic infection
- Intake of antibiotics within 6 months before study entry
- Fasting week within 6 months before study entry
- Habitual use of dietary supplements
- Food intolerances
- Pregnancy, lactation
- Vegan diet
- Smokers
- In addition for fMRI: sensorineural hearing loss, tinnitus, metal implants, electric devices

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data that underlie the results of reported articles (text, tables, figures, supplemental data) will be shared after deidentification.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Beginning 9 months and ending 36 months following article publication.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Researchers who provide a methodologically sound proposal.
